A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
Strange how in the last 24 hours dozens of positive critics have rained into Rotten Tomatoes for this pathetic excuse of a movie after weeks of essentially all negative reviews.
Disney must be really scared to hell by the possibility of not selling a single ticket for the next Star Wars movies due to the massive and increasing quantity and quality of negative critics and scores for this abomination called The Last Jedi.
The more I read the positive critics\, the more I'm convinced they all come from Disney shills\, paid for attempting a rather pathetic and futile damage control.
They talk about old characters honored by the movie\, while in reality they have been assassinated and mocked without a single glimpse of respect from the amateur director and feminazi producer.
They talk about the macroscopic plot holes and the complete disregard of SW lore and rules as small imperfections which do not alter the quality of the movie...
Guys\, do a favor to yourselves: if you don't understand anything about cinema in general and SW in particular\, please avoid commenting here. You only make yourself look foolish and ignorant.
You are defending a movie that will stain Disney's reputation forever.
